description.narrative: MAG will continue to provide emergency humanitarian assistance in Iraq through the delivery of RE sessions to IDPs residing in and outside of camps and to populations returning to areas where high levels of contamination occur. The project includes deployment of 16 MAG community liaison (CL) teams and a total of 12 partner teams to ensure that the most urgent needs are being met for risk mitigation among beneficiaries and emergency response agencies. The teams will work in high need areas of six governorates: Ninewa, Kirkuk, Salah al-Din, Diyala, Sulaymaniyah and Dohuk. With men, women, children, the elderly and disabled persons affected by the threat of contamination differently, CL teams will deliver contextually and culturally appropriate RE sessions. 220,608 individuals will directly benefit from the activities under this grant. MAG and partner teams will provide 216,000 individuals with RE in 14,400 sessions (30% girls, 30% boys, 20% women and 20% men – including individuals with disabilities). MAG and partner teams will also train 4,608 teachers and CFPs to increase the sustainability of the project. Approximately 90% of these beneficiaries are expected to be IDPs.
